name: german_thv_document_stream

fields.fieldDescription: An intermediary who arranges insurance contracts between insurers and clients.
A unique identifier for an insurance policy.
The version number of a document or policy.
A unique identifier for a framework agreement.
The date on which an insurance policy or contract expires.
The name of the person or entity that holds the insurance policy.
The street address of the policyholder.
The postal code of the policyholder's address.
The city where the policyholder resides.
The company providing the insurance coverage.
The date from which an insurance policy is effective.
The reason for any changes made to a policy or contract.
Terms and conditions that apply to an insurance contract.
The current version or status of the general insurance conditions.
Typically refers to special conditions or clauses in a contract (exact meaning can vary).
Current version or status of special conditions in a contract (exact meaning can vary).
Specific risks or circumstances not covered by an insurance policy.
The currency in which payments are made under the policy.
Details about deductible amounts, including minimum and maximum values.
Payment method, indicating how premiums are paid (e.g., monthly, annually).
A one-time gross premium payment.
Gross payment according to payment method.
Net payment according to payment method.
Annual premium.
Base annual premium.
Minimum premium.
Details about the coverage provided under the policy.
Details about the risk factors involved in the policy.
Multiplier used in premium calculation.
The maximum amount payable under the policy.
Number of people covered by the policy.
The product or service associated with the policy.
Revenue generated outside the USA.
Revenue generated within the USA.
Rental value of the insured property.
Type of operation or business covered under the policy.
Details about preventive care or coverage.
Versicherungssumme: Insurance sum/coverage amount
Mitversichert: Co-insured/included in coverage
beschäftigte: Employees
Type of animal.
Number of dogs insured, with a range from 1 to 15.
Indicates whether the animal is purebred.
Dog breed.
Call name or nickname of the animal.
Age of the animal.
Age of the policyholder (Versicherungsnehmer).
Animal identification number or tag.
Indicates if the policyholder works in public service.
Personal liability coverage amount.
Financial liability coverage amount.
Liability coverage for rented property damage.
Coverage for default, providing protection if a liable party cannot pay damages.
Indicates if someone else is allowed to care for the animal.
Scope of coverage or geographical area where the insurance is valid.
Number of horses insured, with a range from 1 to 15.
Type or category of horse.
Life number or unique identification number for horses.
Age of the horse.
Indicates if someone other than the owner rides the horse.
Indicates if there are shared riding arrangements.

modelDescription: This stream processes general J_contract documents, capturing key insurance details including policyholder information, risk factors, premiums, and coverage terms. It is designed for versatile insurance processing while maintaining industry-standard terminology.
